intro: Metrosideros aspera, commonly known as the rough shieldvine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture, which gives it its common name. Metrosideros aspera is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and forested areas.
